meanings.definition: To cause to appear mean or unworthy
meanings.sent1: She bemeaned her friend by making fun of her clothes.
meanings.sent2: The bully bemeaned the new student by calling him names.
meanings.sent3: The mean girl bemeaned her classmates with hurtful comments.
meanings.sent4: His actions bemeaned the reputation of the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The harsh words bemeaned her self-esteem.

meanings.definition: To lower in rank or dignity
meanings.sent1: The demotion bemeaned him in front of his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The scandal bemeaned the once-respected politician.
meanings.sent3: The award ceremony accidentally bemeaned the guest of honor.
meanings.sent4: The defeat in the final match bemeaned the team's hard work.
meanings.sent5: The unfair treatment bemeaned her position in the company.

meanings.definition: To express disapproval or contempt for
meanings.sent1: She bemeaned his taste in music by calling it terrible.
meanings.sent2: The critic bemeaned the movie for its lack of originality.
meanings.sent3: The judge's harsh comments bemeaned the defendant in court.
meanings.sent4: His sarcastic remarks bemeaned her efforts to help.
meanings.sent5: The rude behavior bemeaned the atmosphere of the party.
